meanings.definition: A condition in which the two eyes have unequal refractive power.
meanings.sent1: Aniseikonia can cause difficulties in perceiving depth accurately.
meanings.sent2: The optometrist diagnosed the patient with aniseikonia after conducting an eye exam.
meanings.sent3: The aniseikonia in his eyes made him see the world slightly differently, like wearing glasses with one lens missing.
meanings.sent4: Her aniseikonia was like looking through a funhouse mirror, distorting reality.
meanings.sent5: The aniseikonia in her vision was like trying to fit two mismatched puzzle pieces together.

meanings.definition: The difference in apparent size or shape of images seen by each eye.
meanings.sent1: The aniseikonia between his eyes caused one image to appear larger than the other.
meanings.sent2: Aniseikonia can lead to difficulties in merging the two images into one coherent picture.
meanings.sent3: His aniseikonia was like watching a 3D movie without the glasses, with images slightly out of sync.
meanings.sent4: The aniseikonia in her vision was like seeing the world through a distorted lens, where objects seemed to warp.
meanings.sent5: The aniseikonia in his eyes made it challenging to judge distances accurately.
